title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 63.5 - Investments by savings banks life insurance departments
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 63.5 - Investments by savings banks life insurance departments

State Regulations

The life insurance department of a savings bank may invest in
the capital stock, capital notes and debentures of a savings banks trust
company or service agency, provided the aggregate amount of its investments in
such stock, notes and debentures, including the proposed investment, would not
exceed the greater of two percent of the sum of its policy reserves and policy
liabilities or $20,000. The term policy reserves and policy liabilities shall
have the meaning specified in Banking Law, section 275. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
63.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
